cab.content: $MOI k oThe circulation of this paper has been strictly limited.It is issued for the personal use of...........................TOP secret copy No.V4CP.(56) 2286th October, 1956CABINETTHE QUEEN'S SPEECH ON THEOPENING OF parliament note by the Lord Privy seal i circulate herewith, for the consideration of the Cabinet, a draftof The Queen's Speech on the Opening of Parliament.R.A.B.Office of the Lord Privy Seal, S. W. 1.5th October, 1956. THE QUEEN'S SPEECH ON THEOPENING OF parliament my LORDS AND MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF commons. I look forward^ith great pleasure to visiting with my Dear HusbandDenmark and France / and Portugal/.2. In their relations with foreign powers My Government will continueto play their full part in the work of the United Nations, to which they attach the highest importance./passage to be inserted here on the Suez, situation with reference toprogress made by the United Nations and any other developments. Thispassage will have to be provided at a date close to that on which the Speechis to be given.7 They welcome the widespread support in the recentdiscussion of the Disarmament Commission for the principles which inspiretheir approach to the problems of international disarmament, and will persist in their efforts to reach a solution which will contribute to themaintenance of enduring peace and security among nations.3. My Government will pursue their policy of developing close andintimate relations with their Allies in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisa-tion and Western European Union. They continue to regard the atlantic alliance as fundamental to peace and security and will play a full part indevelooing its strength and vitality.4. My Ministers regard as of first importance the maintenance and strengthening of good relations with the Government of the United Statesof America, with whom they will continue to work in close consultation.5. The Bagdad Pact and the South East Asia Treaty Organisation willcontinue to receive the full support of My Government in co-operation withthe other members of these alliances.6, My Government will continue to work for the improvement anddevelopment of Anglo-Soviet relations.7. Close co-operation with other members of the Commonwealth willremain a principal object of My Ministers' policy and their efforts will be devoted to furthering the development of free institutions within theCommonwealth.o. A Bill will be introduced early in this session to grant independence to the Gold Coast under the name of "Ghana", and it is the intention ofMy Ministers that independence should take effect on 6th March, 1957. TheGold Coast Legislative Assembly have expressed the desire that the gold coast should be an independent State within the Commonwealth.DRAFT 9. f My Ministers hope to introduce legislation providing for full self-government and independence within the Commonwealth for theFederation of Malaya./10. / My Ministers expect to lay before Farliament a Dill to giveeffect to recommendations of the Malta Round Table Conference^/11. Orders in Council will be laid before you to provide for theconstitution of the new British Caribbean Federation and for the inclusionof a number of elected members in the Legislature of Eritish Guiana.My Government hope that it will prove possible for the delayed Conferenceon the Constitution of Nigeria to meet early in the New Year.1Z. My Ministers, while continuing to take the measures which areunhaopily necessary to deal with terrorist activity in Cyprus, will spare no effort to find a solution to the problems of the Island, based on a new and liberal Constitution which will safeguard the rights of all communities andthe essential interests of this country and our Allies.13. My Government will pursue their policy of adjusting the structure ofMy Forces and the organisation of home defence to changes in the world situation in the light of scientific and technical advances, in order thatthis country may continue, in concert with My Allies, to play its full partin the maintenance of peace and the promotion of economic stability and prosperity.14. When the Select Committee on the Naval Discipline Act reports,My Ministers will introduce amending legislation.15. /""a measure will be laid before you to reform the composition ofthe House of Lords.7MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF COMMONS16. Estimates for the public services will be laid before you in due course.MY LORDS AND MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF COMMONS17. My Ministers will continue to strive for the collaboration ofemployers and workers in combining full employment, rising productionand stable prices. They are convinced that the wisdom and experienceof My People will be a powerful aid to them in this task, success in whichis essential to the future growth of the strength and prosperity of my country. It will be the aim of My Government to fortify the balance ofpayments and to extend oversea markets for our goods and services.18. Legislation, consistent with My Governments international obliga-tions, will be introduced to allow countervailing and anti-dumping duties to be imposed on imported goods.19. Legislation will be introduced to replace the existing emergency powers in respect of hire-purchase and hiring agreements and to regulateborrowing by hire-purchase finance companies.20. Steps will be taken to continue the lending powers of the national film Finance Corporation and to substitute a statutory levy on exhibitorsfor the present voluntary levy. Zl. My Ministers will make it a primary aim of their policy toencourage the maximum economic production from our land so that theagricultural industry may have full confidence in the future. my ministers will continue to promote the efficient marketing of food.22. A Dill will be introduced to continue financial assistance to, and make further provision for modernising, certain sections of the fishingfleet.23. A measure will be laid before you to give effect to proposals arisingfrom the recent comprehensive review of the financial and economic position and prospects of the British Transport Commission. / my government intend to press ahead with the proposals already announcedfor the improvement of the roads and railways./24. f"Legislation will be introduced to re-organise the nationalisedelectricity supply industry in England and Wales./25. A measure will be introduced to provide a remedy for damage caused by subsidence resulting from coal mining.26. My Government will give further consideration to the finance oflocal government with a view to legislation in England and Walesf particularly in regard teethe rateable values of shops and certain other classes of property./27. My Government have completed their review of the Rent Acts,and amending legislation will be introduced.28. Legislation will be laid before you to revise Scottish housing subsidies and to facilitate the relief of congested local authority areas inSc otland.29. My Government will press on with the plans they have announcedfor meeting the needs of the modern age by expanding facilities for technical education. They will also continue to give a high place in thebuilding programme to new schools.30. Legislation to amend the law about the closing hours of shops and related matters will be introduced.31. A Bill will be introduced to enable increases in the pay and allowances of members of the police, fire and probation services to begiven retrospective effect.32. Proposals to amend the law of murder and to limit the scope ofcapital punishment will be brought before you.33. Other measures will be laid before you in due course.MY LORDS AND MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE OF COMMONS34. I pray that the blessing of Almighty God may rest upon your counsels.
